result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth R Onsgard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with users or dealers of illicit drugs or controlled substances

The def is not to be at any location where illicit drugs or controlled substances are at, found, used or sold

Contact with Gifford G. is left up to discretion of the PO
.

Complete any other assessments and/or treatment PO deems necessary

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
To be served on Electronic Monitoring with Justice Sanctions
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth R Onsgard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State by Hynek /  Def in custody w/ Atty Patricia O'Neil
Neg Plea / Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Ineligible Voting Notice filed
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
Ct 1 - Def pleads GUILTY
Remaining Cts are Dismissed & read-in
CRT:  Plea is F&V made - finds def guilty
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 2 yrs w/ conditions:  90 days CJ w/ credit for 20 days - to be served on EM w/ JS;  AODA & follow-thru;  The def is not to consume or possess any alcohol, drugs or cont subs w/o valid prescription, w/ random testing;  No Contact w/ any users or dealers of illicit drugs or cont subs;  Def is not to be at any location where illicit drugs or cont subs are at, found, used or sold;  Contact w/ Gifford G. is left up to discretion of the PO;  Complete any other assessments & trmt PO deems necessary;  Pay CC & DOC fees

3:15 pm Def in court w/ Atty Patricia L. O'Neil.  Def in custody.  Emily E. Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
O'Neil reviewing the Statement as to Negotiated Plea now.  Didn't know there was a no contact with Gifford Guy.  He's Mr. Onsgard's care take and partner.  Hynek was out sick and was just told to do the SNP for court today.  We didn't discuss it.  O'Neil take a minute to speak with Mr. Onsgard about this.  Ms. O'Neil would like this continued to Monday.  Mr. Guy states he worked for GT Financial and caring for Mr. ONsgard through them.  I no longer work for GT Financial.  I just take care of him myself.  It's his house but I leve there.  Mr. Onsgard is GT Financial's boss.  He would need to ask them who he wants.  Court comments about the complaints and drug dealings going on in the house.   If they neighbors knows what's going on, how can you not know?  That raises dome questions.  I'm out on bond in Trempealeau Co.  O'Neil:  They can have someone else in the home but that doesn't address the 14 year partnership.
COURT:  Get a time from Andrea for Monday.   Bond to continue.

11:03 am Def in court w/ Atty P. O'Neil.  Def in custody.  Timothy Gruenke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea discussions.  Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds the waiver of the PH is F & V made.  Probable cause found - Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Stands Mute - NG Pleas entered.

PTC: 10/3 at 3:30 pm      STC:  10/30 at 10 am   SLH        Bond to continue.

Cash bond required to remain
Jail sent email, they can manage the defendant's health care needs

Gifford Guy present - he is Defendant;s care giver, Def needs medical care.
Court wants input from Sheriff's Dept on their ability to provide medical care for the defendant.
Cash bond to remain
PH: 09-12-14 at 11:00am w/SLH
Call: 09-08-14 at 1:30pm w/SLH

Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination filed
$2500.00 Cash Bond required w/cond: No Contact with any drug users or dealers
No controlled substances w/out a valid prescription
Referred to JS
Initial: 09-05-14 at 1:30pm
